HELP - List Panel Screen

This screen displays list of players on the current panel. The name of the panel is displayed at the top of the screen. (If panel name is null use the the rename panel to assign a name.)

On startup for first time screen will be empty. Touch + to get started, you will be prompted to enter a Panel Name first and then the details of the first player on the panel

Touch + to add additional players to the current panel

Swipe up and down to scroll if list extends off end of screen

Touch on a player row to see and / or edit player details

LongPress a player row to get options to:
1. delete player
2. make phone call to player
3. send text to player

Drop Down Menu
• new panel creates a new panel. Enter the name for the new panel. The existing panel will be saved and can be returned to using the change panel option
• change panel changes to another previously entered panel.
• rename panel changes the name of a panel. Select the panel you want to rename and enter a new name
• delete panel select panel to delete
• import panel load a saved panel from storage. You will need to have a file explorer APP (e.g. ES File Explorer) installed to list the available files. Note: Panel files are stored by default in the match_teams directory on your devices External storage directory. You can use a File Explorer App to view contents of match_teams directory
• export panel save the current panel to the device (panels are stored in a directory named match_teams)


Importing existing panels
If you have an existing panel (in a spreadsheet for example), format it as a csv file and put in the match_teams directory on your devices external storage to import it to the app. The easist way to get the correct format is to examine an exported file.

touch back button to return to previous screen.

HELP - Create / Edit Player Screen

Enter player details here.

You must enter a Nickname as a minimum to be able to Save a player. Other fields are optional. The Nickname must be between 3 and 6 characters long.

Touch Save to create a new player or save edits to an existing player.

HELP - Review Screens

View list of match statistics

LongPress a row to get options to delete it

HELP - Attendance Screen

Enter date, location and any comments here.

Touch the select players present button to display a list of players on the panel. Touch the checkboxes beside each player to record their attendance. Swipe/Scroll to see full list if necessary. Click OK when finished.

A list of selected players will be displayed on return.

Touch the select players present button again to add or remove players from the list

Touch save players to save the list of attending players to the database.

Filters
Use filters to save and view attendance at specific events. So for example, create a match filter for matches, a training filter for training, gym for conditioning session etc.
When a filter is set and data is saved with the filter, the list of events and review attendance sections will only display events for the set filter.
Reset to No Filter to see all events data

Touch review attendance by player to get a summary of attendance for each player at each training training session. Note that your device must be able to open csv files.

Touch email attendance to save and email the attendance summary. The summary will be saved and emailed as a csv file called training_summary.csv

list of training sessions
Touch on a row/date to see details for that specific training session.
Long press on a row/date to delete details of a specific training session.

Contact Details:
email: gaaapps@gmail.com
twitter: follow @gaaapps for updates
If you are interested in a customised version or additional features or in training in how to use the App, please contact email address.

This App allows you to:
• to store contact details for a panel of players
• to record attendance at training
• time and keep score for a football match
• record team and player performance statistics
• review some summary statistics instantly
• save / share / email raw statistucs data in a csv format which can be opened in spreadsheet software for more detailed analysis later

It is recommended that you install the Twitter App and a File Explorer App (e.g. ES File Explorer) on your device to make use of all the features of this App

Use the manage panel section to enter your team name and players.
Record and monitor attendance in the manage attendance section.
Long press on start new match to select a team lineup, time and record match stats, and to review stats for a new match.
Click on continue existing match to return to details of an existing match.
After a match is complete, click on save/share match data to save and share/email a full set of match events, scores, stats, team lineups. This data can be opened as a spreadsheet for more detailed analysis subsequently.
setup allows you to configure certain settings in the App and to configure custom statistics for your own use.

HELP - Start Screen

help
Touch ? in menu bar at the top to get help in any screen.

manage panel
Touch to create and manage panels, players and contact details.

manage training
Touch to record and display and share attendance at training / matches / events.

start new match
(you have to long press button to get this to work)
NOTE:All match related data - timer/scores/statistics - is deleted/reset and a new match setup will begin.
Panel details and the team lineup from the previous match are retained.

continue existing match
What it says!. All current match data is retained.

save / share match data
match and statitics data for the current match is backed up to device storage and can be shared/emailed.
Files stored/emailed are:
• shots.csv
• frees.csv
• kickouts.csv
• custom.csv
• positions.csv
The .csv files can be opened with spreadsheet software

setup
In this section you can configure certain App settings and setup custom statistics recording
There are 3 sections. In all 3, click on the text you want to edit and enter the new value. When you are finished click save all to save all entries and quit.
Click quit to exit without saving.
Click reset all to default to reset all values to the original App default values.

quit
quit app. No data is deleted.

touch back button to return to previous screen.

HELP - SETUP screen

This screen is used to enter match details, and make/save team selection.

By default, the team selection from the last match is retained so you can edit it rather than start from scratch. To clear the team selection long press the reset team button.

Enter Date, Opposition Team name and Location at top of the screen. Own team name defaults to the current panel name. To change it go into the manage panel section.

To select the team, touch on one of the position buttons. This will display a list of players on your panel. Swipe/scroll, if necessary, to see all players and touch one to select. Repeat for all the positions

It is not necessary to select a player for all or any of the positions, you can just leave the number if you prefer.

Select RESET POSITION TO NUMBER to reset any position.

If you need to enter new player names, use the back button to get out to the home menu screen and go into the manage panel section. When you have finished entering new names touch continue existing match to continue setting up team.

swipe screen or touch tab at top to change to RECORD or REVIEW screens.

touch back button to return to Start screen.

HELP - RECORD screen

TIMER SECTION
Touch the mins/half button to set how long the match will be. You can do this while the timer is running if you forget to do it at the start.
Touch the start button to start the match timer. Screen will update with start time, time gone and time left in the half.
You can touch the - and + to adjust the time by 30 secs if necessary while the timer is running.
Touch stop to end the first half and start again to commence the second half.

Touching stop at the end of each half also saves the score and start times to the database.

SCORE SECTION
Touch the goals and points buttons to increment the scores.
Touch the - and + buttons to decrement the scores.

RESET SECTION
Long touch to reset match timer and/or score and/or stats.

RECORD STATS SECTION
In this section you can record info/statistics pertaining to shots, frees and kick outs for your own team and the opposition. Own team always refers to the team on the left of the screen

Touch the shot / free / kick out / custom buttons to record stats.

The five most recent stats entries recorded are displayed at bottom of screen. If you make a mistake, press undo last stats entry to delete the most recent entry and then reenter the stat

1. Shots
You can record:
• shot outcome
• shot type
• for your own team, the player name who took shot
• for opposition team, the player number who took shot
• zone on pitch from where shot was taken. (Note your own goal is always at the bottom of screen with opposition on top.)

2. Frees
You can record:
• reason for free (note that these can be customised in the setup section.
• zone on pitch where free was conceded
• for your own team, which player, if applicable, was committed the foul.
• for opposition team, if applicable, which of your own players was responsible for winning the free


3. Kick Outs
You can record:
• kick out outcome
• zone on pitch where kick out was won or lost
• for your own team, which player, if applicable, won or lost the kick out


4. custom
You can record custom stats / events:
• custom stats/events can be configured in the setup section
• which player is associated with the event/stat
• zone on pitch where event/stat occured

Touch undo last stats entry to delete the last stats entry if you made an error. You can delete up to the 5 most recent entries.

swipe screen or touch tabs at top to change to SETUP or REVIEW screens.

touch back button to return to Start screen.

HELP - REVIEW screen

The review screen presents a summary of recorded statistics for the current match.

The shots by player, review shots, review frees, review kickouts and review custom buttons display a detailed list of all data / statistics recorded.

touch back button to return to Start screen.
